intro: Sorocea cufodontii, commonly known as the Cufodontii sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
